required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Driving Pressure-guided PEEP Titration in Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Surgeries
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Driving Pressure Based Ventilation Strategy in Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Surgeries With Steep Trendelenburg Position: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of driving-pressure guided positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) titration.

primary_outcome.description: The score is calculated by adding up the 12 individual part scores assessed using lung ultrasound. The score for each part ranges from 0 to 3.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative (at the end of operation before emergence)
secondary_outcome.description: The score is calculated by adding up the 12 individual part scores assessed using lung ultrasound. The score for each part ranges from 0 to 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative (30 minutes after designated PEEP applied)
secondary_outcome.description: Partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Partial pressure of arterial oxygen/fraction of inspired oxygen ratio
Extubation failure, Fever, respiratory infection, respiratory failure, pleural effusion, atelectasis, pneumothorax, bronchospasm, aspiration pneumonitis, pneumonia

arm_group.description: The selected PEEP which makes the driving pressure lowest is applied during the operation.

intervention.intervention_name: Titrated PEEP based on driving pressure
intervention.description: Alveolar recruitment and PEEP titration is performed at three time points: after intubation, after Trendelenburg, and after supine after CO2 deflation. The level of PEEP which makes the driving pressure lowest is selected and applied during the operation.
Alveolar recruitment is performed at three time points: after intubation, after Trendelenburg, and after supine after CO2 deflation. Conventional PEEP (5cmH2O) is applied during the operation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy with Trendelenburg position
Exclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status IV or more
- Severe cardiovascular disease
- Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, emphysema
- History of pneumothorax, bullae
- History of lung resection surgery
- Conversion to laparotomy
- Refusal to participate
